text: Hi <@UHDNY2YMA>, I was looking at the JuliaCon talk <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ekF8ApjPYWk> and was wondering where I can find the example code that is shown in the end, scripts/nf_banana.jl? Thanks.

attachments.title: JuliaCon 2020 | Bijectors.jl: Transforming probability distributions in Julia | Tor Erlend Fjelde
attachments.fallback: YouTube Video: JuliaCon 2020 | Bijectors.jl: Transforming probability distributions in Julia | Tor Erlend Fjelde
attachments.video_html: <iframe width="400" height="225" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/ekF8ApjPYWk?feature=oembed&autoplay=1&iv_load_policy=3" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

elements.text: , I was looking at the JuliaCon talk
and was wondering where I can find the example code that is shown in the end, scripts/nf_banana.jl? Thanks.

text:
Hey! The code is here: <https://github.com/torfjelde/presentations/blob/master/juliacon-2020-bijectors/scripts/nf_banana.jl>

Buuuuut it's quite outdated at this point. Uncertain whether or not it's going to just work.

elements.text: Buuuuut it's quite outdated at this point. Uncertain whether or not it's going to just work.

text: E.g. the LeakyReLU is actually in Bijectors.jl now: <https://github.com/TuringLang/Bijectors.jl/blob/ad6b01c4a214562ef845ab3b5a0a296b348e1ba9/src/bijectors/leaky_relu.jl#L10>

elements.text: E.g. the LeakyReLU is actually in Bijectors.jl now:

text: We're veeery close to updating our Tutorial-pipeline over at TuringTutorials.jl, at which point it would be very interesting to write a tutorial on normalizing flows

elements.text: We're veeery close to updating our Tutorial-pipeline over at TuringTutorials.jl, at which point it would be very interesting to write a tutorial on normalizing flows

text: If you do give it a try, do let me know what doesn't work and I'll try to make changes accordingly:)

elements.text: If you do give it a try, do let me know what doesn't work and I'll try to make changes accordingly:)

text: Sure, no problem. I’m not sure whether I need to look into normalizing flows at this time, but I’ll let you now and keep an eye out for updates in TuringTutorials.jl

elements.text: Sure, no problem. I’m not sure whether I need to look into normalizing flows at this time, but I’ll let you now and keep an eye out for updates in TuringTutorials.jl
